channel.copyright: Copyright 2015 The New York Times Company

item.title: Suicide Bomber Attacks Istanbul Police Station
item.description: A woman walked into an Istanbul police station and blew herself up, wounding two officers, the second attack on the police in the city in a week.
item.dc:creator: By CEYLAN YEGINSU
item.media:description: The street leading to the police station where a suicide bomber blew herself up on Tuesday.

item.title: Pentagon Memo: Obama Nears Goal for Guantánamo With Faster Pace of Releases
item.description: A series of secret nighttime flights over the last two months has brought the administration closer to meeting the president’s promise to empty the military prison in Cuba.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.dc:creator: By HELENE COOPER
item.media:description: President Obama with Ashton B. Carter, his nominee for defense secretary, who would oversee releases from Guantánamo.

item.title: Decks Tilting, Crew Grounded Ship Off Southern England to Save It
item.description: The 57,000-ton Hoegh Osaka was run aground on Bramble Bank, a well-marked sandbank off the port of Southampton, to prevent it from capsizing after it began to list.
item.dc:creator: By ALAN COWELL
item.media:description: Tugboat and salvage crews on Monday kept an eye on the Hoegh Osaka, a car-transporting vessel that was run aground on Bramble Bank, off southern England, after it began listing Saturday.

item.title: Four Opposition Activists Die in Clashes in Bangladesh
item.description: The deaths occurred despite a nationwide tightening of security in anticipation of violence on the first anniversary of the governing party’s re-election.
item.dc:creator: By JULFIKAR ALI MANIK and NIDA NAJAR

item.title: News Analysis: Palestinians Seen Gaining Momentum in Quest for Statehood
item.description: Palestinians have begun to translate a series of symbolic steps made outside of negotiations into a strategy that has increased pressure on Israel.
item.dc:creator: By JODI RUDOREN
item.media:description: President Mahmoud Abbas of the Palestinian Authority after a speech Sunday. “The whole world is supporting us,” he has said.

item.title: Shanghai Mourns Victims of New Year’s Eve Stampede
item.description: Friends and relatives of the victims were among those who came to bow, mourn and place flowers in Chen Yi Square, where scores of people were injured or crushed to death.
item.dc:creator: By DAVID BARBOZA

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: University in Xi’an Opens School of Cyberengineering
item.description: The move by Xidian University, with more than 30,000 students on two campuses, was a sign that cybersecurity had become an increasingly important academic discipline for the Chinese government and military.
item.category: Center for a New American Security
item.dc:creator: By EDWARD WONG
item.media:credit: Sim Chi Yin for The New York Times
item.media:description: The move was a sign that cybersecurity had become an increasingly important academic discipline for the Chinese government and military.

item.title: China Arrests Activist Who Assisted in Daring 2012 Escape
item.description: Guo Yushan, who helped the prominent rights advocate Chen Guangcheng flee house arrest in 2012, has been arrested and charged with operating an illegal business.
item.dc:creator: By EDWARD WONG

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: A Chinese Propaganda Icon Loses a Layer of Myth
item.description: The origin of a tale about cadets at the United States Military Academy at West Point learning about the notorious soldier Lei Feng has been revealed.
item.dc:creator: By AUSTIN RAMZY
item.media:description: A visitor posing in front of images of Lei Feng at a Beijing exhibition in 2013 marking the 50th anniversary of "Learn from Lei Feng Day."

item.title: Hong Kong Insists Voting Will Abide by China’s Rules
item.description: The city government used a report originally offered as a concession to protesters to warn that the authorities would not shift course from plans laid down by Beijing.
item.dc:creator: By ALAN WONG
item.media:description: A supporter of the pro-democracy movement at the last remaining tents outside the government building in Hong Kong on Tuesday.

item.title: French Leader Urges End to Sanctions Against Russia Over Ukraine
item.description: Backing Vladimir V. Putin into a corner will not work, President François Hollande of France said, reflecting sanctions fatigue among European officials.
item.dc:creator: By ANDREW E. KRAMER

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: In Invoking Shanghai Stampede, College Stirs Outrage
item.description: The university in Xi’an, which had banned Christmas celebrations, published a statement titled, “The unfortunate Shanghai holiday stampede tragedy confirms that our school’s position on holiday management is indisputably correct.”
item.dc:creator: By JESS MACY YU
item.media:description: A boy prepared to pray on Saturday for the victims of the New Year's Eve stampede in Shanghai.

item.title: Camp Taji Journal: U.S. Forces, Returning to Iraq, Unearth the Things Their Brethren Carried
item.description: The service members have found themselves re-occupying some of their old places and discovering everyday items that were left behind.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By TIM ARANGO
item.media:credit: Ayman Oghanna for The New York Times
item.media:description: American military personnel, recently deployed to Iraq, found remnants of the previous United States military presence, mostly untouched since their comrades left Camp Taji three years earlier.

item.title: World Briefing: Libya: Apology After Airstrike
item.description: Fighter jets sent by Libya’s internationally recognized government bombed a Greek-owned tanker ship off an eastern city controlled by Islamist extremists on Monday.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing: Congo: Rebels Under Attack
item.description: United Nations and Congolese troops launched airstrikes and a ground offensive against remnants of a Burundian rebel group based in an eastern region of the Democratic Republic of Congo, a United Nations military spokesman said.
item.category: Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda
item.dc:creator: By REUTERS

item.title: Leo Tindemans, 92, Dies; Belgian Prime Minister and Voice for European Unity
item.description: Mr. Tindemans saw European integration and a single currency as a means of overcoming the virulent nationalism of the past.
item.dc:creator: By DAN BILEFSKY
item.media:description: Leo Tindemans, former prime minister of Belgium, far left, with other European heads of state in 1974.

item.title: Q. and A. on Palestinian Statehood
item.description: Answers about the principles of statehood and how they might apply to the Palestinians.
item.dc:creator: By SOMINI SENGUPTA and PATRICK J. LYONS

item.title: Hezbollah Appears to Acknowledge a Spy at the Top
item.description: Remarks were taken as confirmation of reports that a senior Hezbollah operative had been caught spying for Israel, disrupting several assassination plots abroad.
item.dc:creator: By ANNE BARNARD
item.media:description: Hezbollah fighters at a rally to commemorate the commander Imad Mughniyeh in February 2008 in Beirut, Lebanon. Lebanese and Arab news media identified the mole within Hezbollah as the man charged with exacting revenge for Mr. Mughniyeh's death, but who instead fed information to Israel that foiled five planned retaliation attempts.

item.title: Anti-Immigration Rallies in Germany Defy Calls to Desist
item.description: Despite the calls from Chancellor Angela Merkel appealing to Germans to avoid the marches and their organizers, demonstrators gathered against “economic refugees.”
item.dc:creator: By ALISON SMALE
item.media:description: Anti-immigrant demonstrators held a rally on Monday in Dresden, Germany.

item.title: World Briefing: Turkey: Graft Trial Is Rejected
item.description: A Turkish parliamentary commission voted Monday against prosecuting four former cabinet ministers on corruption charges, effectively backing President Recep Tayyip Erdogan after a scandal rattled his inner circle.
item.dc:creator: By REUTERS
